goal.en: This course provides an advanced study of atmospheric chemistry topics coerving from stratospheric and tropospheric chemsutry to aqueous and aerosol chemistry. Discussions on experimental setup and analytical methods are also given.
goal.ch: This course provides an advanced study of atmospheric chemistry topics coerving from stratospheric and tropospheric chemsutry to aqueous and aerosol chemistry. Discussions on experimental setup and analytical methods are also given.

content.en:
1. Stratospheric Chemistry - Ozone chemistry
2. Tropospheric Chemistry – Air pollution chemistry
3. Aqueous Chemistry
4. Aerosol Chemistry
5. Measurements and Analytical Methods

textbook.en:
"Textbooks:
No specific textbooks are assigned.
References:
Chemistry of Atmospheres, R. P. Wayne, 3rd Ed. 2000.
Atmospheric Chemistry and Physics from Air Pollution to Climate change, J. H. Seinfeld and S. N. Pandis, 2nd Ed. 2006.
Chemistry of the Natural Atmospheres, P. Warneck, 1988.
Atmospheric Chemistry: Fundamentals and Experimental Techniques, B. J. Finlayson-Pitts and J. N. Pitts, Jr., 1986.
Analytical Techniquies for Atmospheric Measurement, Edited by D. E. Heard, 2006.
Journals of Interest:
1. Atmospheric Environment
2. J. of Geophysical Research - Atmosphere
3. Geophysical Research Letter
4. J. of Atmospheric Chemistry
5. J. of Applied Meteorology
6. Tellus
7. J. of Atmospheric Research
8. Environmental Science and Technology
9. Atmospheric Chemistry and Physics"
